is the time it takes after disruption to restore a business process to its service level and this is defined
usually by an operational agreement for example if your disaster occurs at something like maybe twelve o'clock or
noon right and the RTO is an hour d our process should restore the business processes to an acceptable service level
by 1:00 p.m. right and then RPO is the acceptable amount of data loss measured
in time so again if you're if your disaster happens at twelve o'clock or noon and the RPO is one hour the system
should recover all data that was in the system before 11:00 a.m. data loss will only span that one hour
between eleven and twelve so a company typically decides on an acceptable RTO
and RPO based on the financial impact to the business when systems are unavailable and the company determines
financial impact by considering a lot of factors things like loss of business and damage to reputation due to downtime and
the lack of systems availability so IT organizations then plan solutions to
